name: py-cloudpickle

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: Extended pickling support for Python objects.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependent_to.name: py-dask-glm
dependent_to.description:
Dask-glm is a library for fitting Generalized Linear Models on large
datasets.

dependent_to.name: py-gym
dependent_to.description:
OpenAI Gym is a toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement
learning algorithms. This is the gym open-source library, which gives
you access to a standardized set of environments.

dependent_to.name: py-datacube
dependent_to.description: An analysis environment for satellite and other earth observation data.

dependent_to.name: py-abcpy
dependent_to.description:
ABCpy is a highly modular, scientific library for approximate Bayesian
computation (ABC) written in Python. It is designed to run all included
ABC algorithms in parallel, either using multiple cores of a single
computer or using an Apache Spark or MPI enabled cluster.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.

dependent_to.name: py-mlflow
dependent_to.description: MLflow: A Platform for ML Development and Productionization.

dependent_to.name: py-dask
dependent_to.description: Dask is a flexible parallel computing library for analytics.

dependent_to.name: pygmo
dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.

dependent_to.name: py-submitit
dependent_to.description: Python toolbox for submitting jobs to Slurm.

dependent_to.name: py-melissa-core
dependent_to.description:
Melissa is a file-avoiding, adaptive, fault-tolerant and elastic
framework, to run large-scale sensitivity analysis or deep-surrogate
training on supercomputers. This package builds the launcher and server
modules.

dependent_to.name: openturns
dependent_to.description:
OpenTURNS is a scientific C++ and Python library featuring an internal
data model and algorithms dedicated to the treatment of uncertainties.
The main goal of this library is to provide all functionalities needed
to treat uncertainties in studies with industrial applications. Targeted
users are all engineers who want to introduce the probabilistic
dimension in their so far deterministic studies.

dependent_to.name: py-rios
dependent_to.description:
Raster I/O Simplification. A set of python modules which makes it easy
to write raster processing code in Python. Built on top of GDAL, it
handles the details of opening and closing files, checking alignment of
projection and raster grid, stepping through the raster in small blocks,
etc., allowing the programmer to concentrate on the processing involved.

dependent_to.name: py-horovod
dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

dependent_to.name: py-hyperopt
dependent_to.description:
Hyperopt is a Python library for serial and parallel optimization over
awkward search spaces, which may include real-valued, discrete, and
conditional dimensions.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow-probability
dependent_to.description:
TensorFlow Probability (TFP) is a Python library built on TensorFlow
that makes it easy to combine probabilistic models and deep learning on
modern hardware (TPU, GPU). It's for data scientists, statisticians, ML
researchers, and practitioners who want to encode domain knowledge to
understand data and make predictions.

dependent_to.name: py-shap
dependent_to.description:
SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations): a unified approach to explain the
output of any machine learning model.
